Judul: Integrating systematic layout planning with fuzzy constraint theory to design and optimize the facility layout for operating theatre in hospitals
Abstrak:
Because of the competition of the medical market
and the importance of the operaing theatre (OT), the
OT process efficiency becomes a hot spot problem in hospital
management. The OT facility layout is not only a problem
about cost reduction, but also a great contribute to the
efficiency of OT process. However, the facility layout optimization
of OT was always ignored in the past decades. In
order to become more competitive in the medical market, the
facility layout of OT should be considered as an essential
section in early design phase. To overcome these problems,
this paper proposed a approach for designing and optimizing
the facility layout of OT in hospitals. First, systematic
layout planning (SLP) is applied to design the layout of OT
based on the logistics and non-logistics relationships. The
SLP is a tool which is used to arrange a workplace in a
plant by locating two areas with high frequency and logical
relationships close to each other. After that, fuzzy constraint
theory is proposed for comprehensively evaluate the layout
schemes. Fuzzy constraint theory uses objective function and constraint conditions for solving the problem which involves
uncertainty. After designing and optimizing the facility layout
of OT in Shanghai East Hospital, we can get the optimal
layout plan. The aim of this study was development a new
approach to design and optimize the facility layout for OT.
This research results are able to help the hospital managers
to adopt more modern management approaches in every day
practise.
